newsitem.title: CHINA: China details festivities to mark Hong Kong return.
newsitem.headline: China details festivities to mark Hong Kong return.

text.p: China will mark the return of the British colony of Hong Kong to Beijing rule on July 1 with a series of ceremonies in the territory and in the Chinese capital, the Xinhua news agency said on Friday.

On the evening of June 30, the Beijing city government is to play host to more than 60,000 people in central Tiananmen Square to celebrate the end of 156 years of colonial rule in Hong Kong with singing and dancing, the agency said.
In Hong Kong, after the glittering Sino-British handover ceremony at midnight on June 30, Chinese government leaders will preside over the swearing-in of the territory's post-colonial government.
Xinhua did not say which leaders would represent the government at the ceremony.
At 10.00 a.m. (0200 GMT) on July 1, the new government of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region (SAR) is to hold a celebratory conference at the Hong Kong Convention and Exhibition Centre.
At 4.00 p.m. (0800 GMT) the same day, the Hong Kong government plans to hold a reception.
In Beijing, meanwhile, the State Council, or cabinet, will hold a reception for 3,500 people in the Great Hall of the People at 4:30 p.m. (0830 GMT), Xinhua said.
At 8:00 p.m. (1200 GMT), people from various sectors of the capital's population will be guests at a convention at Beijing's Workers' Stadium, followed by an artistic show.
On the evening of July 2, another celebratory show will be staged at the capital's Great Hall of the People.
On or about July 1, meanwhile, China's embassies and consulates abroad will hold receptions to mark Hong Kong's return, Xinhua said.
